title: Wolves to unleash the youngsters for Carabao Cup derby at Aston Villa
text:
Wolves are set to make up to 10 changes for Wednesday's derby at Aston Villa, with more than 5,000 away supporters scheduled to make the trip to Villa Park.

Centre-forward Raul Jimenez, who has featured in 19 of the club's 20 matches this term, is likely to be given a breather by coach Nuno Espirito Santo along with other key players like Joao Moutinho and goalkeeper Rui Patricio.

With Wolves in the middle of a spell of seven games in 23 days across three competitions, Nuno has decided to prioritise the Premier League and Europa League campaigns. It means fans will see an unfamiliar XI take on their Midlands rivals.

Nuno Espirito Santo is planning to make 10 changes for Wolves' EFL Cup game against Villa

Youngsters such as 16-year-old Chem Campbell could be given a chance to shine in the match

Instead, the Molineux boss is set to unleash a number of the club's youngsters, with 16-year-old Chem Campbell poised to become one of the youngest players to appear for the club in the modern era if he is given a taste of the action.

The midfielder, who turns 17 on December 30, would eclipse team-mate Morgan Gibbs-White in the record books if he features. Gibbs-White was 16 years, 11 months and 11 days when he made his first-team debut in January 2017.

Campbell travelled to Bratislava for last week for the Europa League win over Slovan and may be on the bench on Wednesday.

Morgan Gibbs-White may lose his status as youngest ever Wolverhampton Wanderers player

Defender Dion Sanderson, midfielder Taylor Perry and forward Benny Ashley-Seal are among those set to feature.

Meanwhile, the club are due to reveal on Wednesday whether defender Willy Boly requires an operation after breaking his ankle in training last Saturday.
